importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the indictment announcement, indicating a significant legal development involving a high-profile political figure during the 2025 political landscape.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The ongoing legal proceedings in 2025 place the case within the current political and legal environment, affecting public perception and policy discourse.

keyTakeAways: John Bolton, a former national security adviser to President Donald Trump, has been indicted by a federal grand jury in Maryland.
The indictment includes 18 counts: eight for transmitting national defense information and ten for retaining such information.
The case centers on alleged violations of federal laws related to the unauthorized handling of sensitive national defense information.

namedEntities.name: John Bolton
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former national security adviser to President Donald Trump and current legal defendant
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central figure in the indictment, making him a key political and legal figure in the context of U.S. national security and political accountability.

namedEntities.name: President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former U.S. President and former supervisor of John Bolton
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His past role as a political leader and mentor to Bolton provides context for the political dynamics surrounding the indictment.

namedEntities.name: Federal Grand Jury in Maryland
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Legal body that issued the indictment
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The indictment was formally brought by a federal judicial authority, underscoring the legal legitimacy and seriousness of the charges.

namedEntities.name: National Defense Information
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Sensitive information protected under federal law
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The charges are based on unauthorized transmission and retention of classified national defense information, a critical matter of national security.

summaryOfNewsArticle: John Bolton, former national security adviser to President Donald Trump, has been indicted by a federal grand jury in Maryland on 18 counts, including eight for transmitting and ten for retaining national defense information. The case raises significant questions about the handling of classified information and the legal boundaries of former government officials, particularly in the context of political transitions and national security protocols.
title: Full indictment of John Bolton
